metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3841 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
The IPv6 stack in the Linux kernel before 4.3.3 mishandles options data,which allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial of service(use-after-free and system crash) via a crafted sendmsg system call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3841` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-96-generic - 3.13.0-96.143
linux-image-3.13.0-96-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-96.143
linux-image-3.13.0-96-lowlatency - 3.13.0-96.143

linux-image-3.13.0-96-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-96.143

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-96.143').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-lts-vivid package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-69.77~14.04.1').
linux-lts-wily package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-27.32~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
